result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant John Carl Wigley appeared by video.  Attorney Michael F. Hart appeared by video for John Carl Wigley.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Discussions held regarding Amended Information. State places offer on the record, to be revoked after final pretrial. All previously ordered conditions of bail remain. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case is calendared for a plea hearing. Through email communication, Attorney Hart informed the Court that defense was not prepared to proceed with a plea hearing and requested a status date. Case is adjourned OFF THE RECORD in Branch 36.

Defendant John Carl Wigley in court with attorney Michael F. Hart.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case is adjourned for a projected plea hearing.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. State's witness is unavailable. State requests an adjournement. Defense move to dismiss. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant John Carl Wigley in court with Attorney John Thomas Bayer, as friend of court.  Defendant John Carl Wigley in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John Carl Wigley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
